answers.answer: You mentioned you had an exam by an ophthalmologist that was normal. I would talk to the ophthalmologists office and arrange it so that when you have one of these episodies you can come in the same day for the Eye MD to see your eye while the problem is going on. that would be the best was to deal with it.JCH III MD   Ophthalmologist

I have had very similar problems as Needhelp000 and have also had a normal eye-exam -  Doctor, I was wondering if you could say (while we wait for our symptoms to re-appear and to see our docs again), what are the most likely diagnosis for these symptoms,  or a list of possibilities (differentials)?     Thanks so much for your valuable time.
I'm sorry but the symptoms are so non-specific that I could not logically construct a differential diagnosis.JCH III MD

question: I am wondering if you can tell me why I might be getting foggy vision.   I am 30 years old, male... I had a normal opthamologic dilated exam, normal blood tests for diabetes, CBC, metabolics, liver, etc.   normal ocular pressure etc.    But from time to time I get this "film" over my vision in either eye,  one at a time or both eyes,    it is almost as if I can "blink" the fog away with one blink and with the next blink the fog comes back,  so when this happens I tend to get in a "blinking war" (for lack of a better term)  but the problem always resolves but may return days or weeks later.
title: foggy vision
